author: Jackson Richman, Jacob Burg
description: In exchange for all the hostages Hamas is still holding, Israel will release more than 2,000 prisoners, including 250 that are serving life sentences.
title: Israeli Cabinet Approves Gaza Cease-Fire Deal

author: Travis Gillmore
description: The two nations will collectively build 11 ships, four in Finland and seven in the United States.
title: US, Finland Strike $6 Billion Icebreaker Deal

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre is asking for more clarity from Prime Minister Mark Carney regarding his comments that Canada could be sending $1 trillion in investments south of the border. Carney made the comments Oct. 7 during a visit with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House, saying Canada expects to send $1 trillion […]
title: Poilievre Wants Clarity on Carney’s Talk of Sending $1 Trillion in Investments to US

author: Chandra Philip
description: Quebec’s government has tabled a draft constitution that Premier François Legault says will protect his province’s “distinct national character.” Legault’s Canadian Relations Minister Simon Jolin-Barrette tabled the bill on Oct. 9. Legault says the Quebec constitution will be “the law of all laws” and was designed to reinforce provincial autonomy. The premier said in a […]
title: Quebec Government Introduces Draft Constitution to Preserve Province’s ‘Distinct’ Character

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: New Gaza Cease-Fire Deal, 2 Police Officers Shot, and Flocks of Flamingos

author: PA Media
description: Whistleblowers who raised concerns about a major hospital are owed an apology for having had to do so in the first place, a medical director has told an inquiry. Dr Scott Davidson has been medical director at NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde (NHSGGC) since October 2024. Prior to that, he served as deputy medical director […]
title: Whistleblowers Who Raised Hospital Safety Concerns Owed Apology, Inquiry Told

author: PA Media
description: A modified Land Rover described as the first and only vehicle to cross the Bering Strait, a more than 50-mile-wide stretch of water separating Asia and North America at their closest point, is to be sold at auction. The 4×4 had a propeller and two large red floats added to it to successfully complete the […]
title: Floating Land Rover Used to Cross Bering Strait Is to Be Sold at Auction

author: PA Media
description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves has been given an extra £2 billion wriggle room in her upcoming Budget after it was revealed that official Government borrowing figures have been overstated due to inaccurate data on VAT receipts. The Office for National Statistics (ONS) admitted that borrowing for the current financial year to August was £81.8 billion, down […]
title: Chancellor Given £2Bn Budget Boost After VAT Error Sees Borrowing Revised Down

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Bloc Québécois (BQ) is calling on Ottawa to crack down on “exploitative practices” in Canada’s trucking industry, as a House of Commons committee continues to investigate an industry loophole that critics say are making the roads more dangerous. Industry experts have warned that the rapid spread of so-called “Driver Inc.” business practices let operators […]
title: Bloc Québécois Calls for Inquiry Into ‘Exploitative Practices’ in Trucking Industry

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Freedom Convoy leader Tamara Lich said following her sentencing for mischief that she will not apologize for the role she played in the convoy protest, saying it positively impacted thousands of Canadians. Lich said on Oct. 8 that she had discussed with her lawyer Lawrence Greenspon whether she should express remorse prior to the sentencing […]
title: Lich Says She Won’t ‘Apologize’ After Sentencing in Freedom Convoy Trial

author: The Canadian Press
description: Ottawa’s industrial strategy will leverage Canada’s reputation for stability to attract more foreign investment, Industry Minister Mélanie Joly said on Thursday in a speech at the Canadian Club of Toronto. Joly used the event to lay out the federal government’s plan to protect and build up key sectors in Canada, as U.S. President Donald Trump’s […]
title: ‘Stable’ Reputation Makes Canada Attractive to Investors, Joly Says

author: The Canadian Press
description: Two unions representing British Columbia professionals and public service workers escalated their weeks-long job action on Thursday to include about 26,000 staff across 14 ministries and provincial Crown corporations. The Professional Employees Association, whose members include engineers, foresters and geoscientists, said more than 1,000 staff from the health, mining, transportation, resource stewardship and attorney general […]
title: BC Strike Escalates to Include About 26,000 Public Service Workers, Professionals

author: The Canadian Press
description: The head of Canada’s new Major Projects Office and her staff sidestepped MPs’ questions today about whether she has special powers to skirt the West Coast tanker ban. As she was grilled by MPs in her first committee appearance since taking over her new role in late August, Dawn Farrell said 500 projects are waiting […]
title: CEO of New Major Projects Office Grilled by MPs in 1st Committee Appearance

author: Epoch Video
description: President Donald Trump welcomes Finnish President Alexander Stubb and Prime Minister Petteri Orpo to the White House at 3 p.m. ET on Oct. 9.
title: LIVE NOW: Trump Meets With Finnish President, Prime Minister at White House

author: Chandra Philip
description: Premier Danielle Smith has directed her energy minister to boost oil production and move pipeline projects forward. Smith told Energy Minister Brian Jean in an Oct. 2 mandate letter that she expected him to defend the province’s energy and natural resources sector “against federal overreach,” and develop “strategic alliances” with other provinces. The minister was […]
title: Alberta Energy Minister Directed to Focus on Oil Sector, More Pipelines

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Alberta is stepping up efforts to make trucking safer in the province, shutting down a number of driving schools and commercial trucking companies that it says are operating below acceptable standards. The province has ordered five driver training schools to close, suspended operations for 13 commercial trucking companies, sent 39 “disciplinary letters,” applied more than […]
title: Alberta Shuts Down Driving Schools, Trucking Companies, for Not Meeting Provincial Standards

author: Matthew Horwood
description: As legal discussions around the potential seizure of Freedom Convoy leader Chris Barber’s truck are set to continue, his lawyer says there is no legal precedent for an item to be forfeited when it has not previously been seized. “The thing is, this has never happened before,” Barber’s lawyer Brendan Miller told The Epoch Times […]
title: Barber’s Lawyer Says Crown Request to Seize Truck Has ‘Never Happened Before’ in Case Law

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: A British Columbia RCMP officer has been ordered to resign from the force after a conduct board found he operated a vehicle while intoxicated and pointed a handgun at two civilians. Const. Olavo Castro, who was posted at the Williams Lake detachment in B.C., was found to have contravened the RCMP Code of Conduct in […]
title: BC RCMP Officer Ordered to Resign Over Off-Duty Drunk-Driving Incident Involving Gun

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Liberal government has split its border security bill into two to allow certain provisions to pass through Parliament more quickly, saying this would provide additional time to evaluate the more “contentious” measures of the original legislation. Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree introduced Bill C-12, also known as the Strengthening Canada’s Immigration System and Borders […]
title: Liberals Split Border Security Bill to Speed Up Passage Through Parliament

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Families of hostages held by Hamas expressed gratitude to U.S. President Donald Trump and voiced hope for the hostages’ safe return.
title: Celebrations Sweep Israel and Gaza as First Phase of Trump’s Peace Plan Secured

author: Jack Phillips
description: The Nobel Peace Prize winner is due to be announced on Oct. 10 in Norway.
title: Netanyahu Calls for Trump to Receive Nobel Peace Prize Over Israel–Hamas Deal

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: An updated list of the top 25 most wanted fugitives in Canada was released nationwide on Oct. 9, with authorities announcing a combined reward of $600,000 for tips that lead to the apprehension of the individuals listed. Topping Canada’s 25 most wanted list is an alleged gang member from Montreal wanted for the July murder […]
title: Canada’s New 25 Most Wanted List Includes 17 Fugitives Wanted for Murder

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The Danish PM warned that online culture is 'stealing childhood,' and proposed a law change similar to those of Australia and Norway.
title: Denmark to Ban Social Media for Children Under 15 Years

author: Chris Summers
description: Assistant Chief Constable Rob Potts said he is confident Syrian-born Jihad Al-Shamie was 'influenced by extreme Islamist ideology.'
title: UK Synagogue Attacker Pledged Allegiance to ISIS During Emergency Call: Police

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: Israel and Hamas agreed to release hostages and Palestinian prisoners, paving the way to an end to the war.
title: Israel, Hamas Agree to Hostage and Cease-fire Deal

author: The Canadian Press
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has responded to news that Israel and Hamas have agreed to the first phase of a peace plan that would pause fighting in Gaza. On the social media platform X, the prime minister offered his congratulations to U.S. President Donald Trump for orchestrating the deal. He also thanked Qatar, Egypt and […]
title: Gaza Peace Plan Agreed To, Canada Calls for Immediate and Unimpeded Aid

author: The Canadian Press
description: A senior official at the Bank of Canada is calling for more competition in the banking sector to better serve Canadians and the economy. Senior deputy governor Carolyn Rogers laid out her case for a more competitive Canada in a speech at the Canadian Club in Toronto on Thursday morning. Rogers sounded the alarm in […]
title: Senior Bank of Canada Official Calls for More Competition in Banking

author: Guy Birchall
description: The deal is set to see the hostages released, Hamas cede control of Gaza, and Israel withdraw its troops from the enclave.
title: World Leaders Welcome First Phase of Trump’s Gaza Deal

author: The Canadian Press
description: Influencers had the “loudest voices” online in this spring’s federal election, overtaking news outlets and politicians, says a new report. The report from the Canadian Digital Media Research Network, co-ordinated by the McGill University and University of Toronto-led Media Ecosystem Observatory, looked at the election information environment. Influencers were the most active in terms of […]
title: Influencers—Not News Outlets or Politicians—’Dominated’ Election Online: Report

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The department did not reveal the identity of the foreign service diplomat.
title: State Department Fires Diplomat Over Relationship With Woman Accused of Ties to CCP

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Commissioner Krissy Barrett says the agency will consider whether a national security threat exists before launching investigations.
title: Australian Federal Police Chief Says Agency to Refocus on Hybrid Threats

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: With unemployment heading upwards and people deferring spending due to job insecurity, the Reserve Bank has made a 50 basis point cut to interest rates.
title: New Zealand’s Central Bank Drops Cash Rate to 2.5 Percent as Economy Wobbles

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: World leaders welcomed the deal, the first step in Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plan.
title: First Phase of Gaza Deal Agreed—What to Know

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: This week saw Australia sign major defence pacts with India, Singapore, and PNG, reinforcing regional security ties amid the CCP's ongoing influence.
title: India, Australia Sign Pact to Deepen Military Cooperation, Technology Exchange

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: An application had been submitted for an area on Mount Panorama.
title: Indigenous Group’s Land Claim on Mount Panorama Fails

author: Andrew Moran
description: Despite market uncertainty, data showed positive trends in Argentina's economy.
title: Argentina’s Economy on Rise Heading Into Midterm Elections

author: Reuters
description: LONDON–The man whose attack on a synagogue in northern England last week resulted in the deaths of two Jewish worshippers phoned police minutes afterward to say he was acting for the ISIS terrorist group, investigators said on Wednesday. Jihad Al-Shamie, a 35-year-old British citizen of Syrian descent, made the call after driving a car into […]
title: UK Synagogue Attacker Claimed Allegiance to ISIS in Call to Police

author: PA Media
description: Kemi Badenoch promised to abolish stamp duty if the Conservatives win the next election as she closed the party conference. Having focused on borders in her opening address, Mrs Badenoch used her leader’s speech on Wednesday to set out her vision of a country where the state “does less but does it better” and “profit […]
title: Badenoch Vows to Abolish Stamp Duty as She Closes Tory Conference

author: PA Media
description: Kate McCann was left distressed after being confronted on her driveway by two women accused of stalking her, including a Polish national who has falsely claimed to be Madeleine McCann, she told a court. Giving evidence against Karen Spragg, 61, and 24-year-old Julia Wandelt, who both deny stalking, Mrs McCann said she first became aware […]
title: Kate McCann Tells Jury of Distress at Being Visited at Home by Alleged Stalkers

author: Monica O’Shea
description: His comments come after the NSW Court of Appeal blocked a pro-Palestinian protest at the Sydney Opera House.
title: NSW Premier Will Not Light up the Sydney Opera House in Palestinian Colours

author: Monica O’Shea
description: The deal will see hostages released and Israeli troops withdrawn under the first phase, according to Trump.
title: Australian Leaders Praise Trump and US for Securing First Stage of Israel-Hamas Peace Plan

author: Cindy Li
description: 'China may interpret it to mean Australia may attempt to acquire staging bases for strikes on PRC-occupied islands,' said Carl Schuster.
title: PNG Pact Pushes Australia’s Security Frontier to the Edge of the South China Sea: Analyst

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: As cost-of-living pressures rise, more than one in four consumers believe retail theft is justifiable to some degree, a study by Monash University has found.
title: Most Young Australians Believe Retail Theft Is ‘Justified’ as Cost of Living Pressures Grow

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has declined to say whether he will press Narendra Modi about India’s relationship with Russia when the two leaders meet on Thursday. Mr Modi is facing sanctions from U.S. President Donald Trump over his country’s continued purchase of Russian oil, all while the West tightens the screw of sanctions on Moscow. Ahead […]
title: Starmer Declines to Say If He Plans to Press Modi on Close Links With Putin

author: Melanie Sun
description: The 48-51 vote on Wednesday was mostly split along party lines.
title: Senate Votes Down Resolution Seeking to Halt Trump’s Use of Military Force Against Cartel Boats

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW YORK—Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and George Springer each drove in a run, and eight Toronto pitchers shut down the New York Yankees in a 5-2 victory Wednesday night that sent the Blue Jays to the American League Championship Series for the first time in nine years. Nathan Lukes provided a two-run single and Addison Barger […]
title: Blue Jays Beat Yankees 5-2 in Game 4 to Reach First ALCS Since 2016

author: Chandra Philip
description: Elections BC has fined Lululemon founder and billionaire Chip Wilson $600 for posting signs outside his home during the 2024 provincial election without registering as a third party advertising sponsor. The signs were critical of the provincial NDP and David Eby, with one reading, “Eby will tell you the Conservatives are ‘Far Right’ but neglects […]
title: Elections BC Fines Lululemon Founder for Signs Critical of NDP During Election

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Sussan Ley welcomed the contest of ideas in the party room.
title: Jacinta Price Asks Sussan Ley to Take Action on Internal Liberal Party Leaks

author: The Associated Press
description: STOCKHOLM—Three scientists won the Nobel Prize in chemistry Wednesday for their development of new molecular structures that can trap vast quantities of gas inside, laying the groundwork to potentially suck greenhouse gases out of the atmosphere or harvest moisture from desert environments. The chairperson of the committee that made the award compared the structures called […]
title: Nobel Prize in Chemistry Goes to Discovery That Could Trap CO2 and Bring Water to Deserts

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: VICTORIA—A bill calling for parental consent for pronoun change at schools and restrictions on gender transition procedures for minors was narrowly defeated before first reading at the B.C. legislature. The Protecting Minors From Gender Transition Act private member’s bill was tabled by OneBC MLA for Kelowna-Lake Country-Coldstream Tara Armstrong Oct. 8, but was voted down […]
title: BC NDP Votes Down Bill Restricting Childhood Gender Transition Procedures

author: Cindy Li
description: Income apportionment wrongly calculated social security overpayments between 2003 and 2020.
title: Senate Committee Told $600 Not Enough for People Affected by Centrelink Debt Miscalculation

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Former Solicitor General of Canada Wayne Easter is calling for a federal public inquiry into Beijing’s interference operations in Prince Edward Island (P.E.I.), following a two-year investigation detailing how the Chinese regime exploited immigration loopholes and used elite capture to turn Canada’s smallest province into a front-line for foreign influence. Easter, who served as the […]
title: Former Solicitor General Urges Inquiry Into Chinese Interference in PEI, Warns of National Threat

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Nationally, rents increased 4.3 percent in a year up to the end of September. The median rent in Sydney is $807 per week, compared to $615 in Melbourne.
title: Rents in Australia Rise 44 Percent in 5 Years as Vacancy Rate Hits Record Low

author: AAP
description: The NSW Court of Appeal has upheld a police bid to stop a planned pro-Palestine protest at the famous landmark over 'crowd crush' fears.
title: Court Blocks Planned Pro-Palestine Protest at Sydney Opera House
